name: Sinnemary Carbet
description: Run down old municipal campsite in country area beside river, and near to wetland hiking. Note- maybe this has been repaired? It’s not so bad.

name: Boat Ram
description: Parking lot at the end of the road. Option to take boat to Kaw, or visit wetlands by boat (nobody is at the boat ramp, but people will come and go so you can ask them), also a hiking trail goes up the mountain via a path behind the cemetery.

name: Route des Plages RD1 outside Remire-Montjoly
description: Nice and sandy beach with lots of trees. Quiet at night but busy on weekends.

name: Quiet spot behind abandoned hotel
description: Quiet spot behind abandoned hotel (and former police headquarters). Shady, but some sun, too. Police came by once a day and private security made its rounds every few hours (checking in with a beacon right by the building, so they do have to pass by). The abandoned and overgrown marina next door (the gate) was actually home to two really nice elderly French sailors preparing their ships to get sailing again. This is all unofficial of course. I sneaked into the tennis courts next door once to take a shower (early evenings when there are few people). No infrastructure. I would not leave the car there alone for too long.

name: Grassy spot off the road across from visitors' centre
description: Level grassy spot a little of the road, about 200m from the beach (where it is no allowed to camp). At night saw several giant leatherback turtles on the beach. Sun and shade, clouds of mosquitoes at and after sunset (impossible to leave the van). Water tap and bathroom across the street at Visitors’ Centre. Shops and internet (at public library) in village about 1km east along the road. Free.

name: Crique Société la Forestière
description: Quiet relaxed creekside park, picnic tables etc. immediately adjacent to road but not within view of passing vehicles. Minimal traffic and minimal mosquitos, convenient place to pass the night of visiting the villages along the Maroni

name: Wildcamp N2 near St. Georges
description: Nice place in the forest just off the N2, but invisible from the road. No facilities. Big rigs will have trouble to turn to get out.

name: Immigration Office (Police)
description:
Citizens of the EU can enter the country without formalities. 
Now the bridge is opem, the offices are now at the end of the bridge on the FG side

name: Remire-Montjoly -  Motel du Lac
description:
Note: this place is in FRENCH Guiana (not selectable in iOverlander).
Standard motel, no lake visible. We took it because we needed a shower and looked for a safe place near Cayenne. It was expensive and unfriendly. We were not allowed to open the roof of our van or to cook in it. EUR 75 (2 adults, camper)

name: Consulate General of Suriname
description:
Opening hours 9:00-14:00. We got our tourist cards here. Needed: passports only, costs €30 per card, waiting time 30 min. 
(*27 eur, bank card only, no cash - August 11, 2023)

name: CA2P Insurance Company
description: Quoted €224 for one month car insurance.

name: Police Station St. Laurent-du-Maroni
description: This place is in FRENCH Guiana (not selectable in iOverlander). When we arrived at the dock the last ferry of the day had departed. The immigration officer recommended to camp in front of the nearby police station at the beach. When we arrived there he had already called his collegue who stood outside the building to welcome us. We were allowed to use toilet and shower of the police station, but that will totally depend on the office on duty.

name: Nice windy spot at the boat ramp
description: Nice spot, lot of cool wind at the commune de remire. We ask permission. No problem.

name: By ferry
description: Very good place for waiting at the ferry quite and safe and cool at night.

name: Saut Maripa
description: Arrived at this place after a boat ride and a short trek with local friends but there is a dirty road that reach this beautiful place. There is a river to fish. Road is good for all vehicles. No cellphone reception.

name: Cacao
description: Beautiful, quiet at night, almost flat area next to a boat ramp under the trees. You can use the toilets and shower in the building of the post office. restaurants close by.

name: Abandoned facilities
description:
Chutes de Fourgassier, abandoned buildings but flat area to park. Hidden from the main road, a few houses at the entrance but very calm at night.
Access road is not in good condition but posible without 4WD. Really beautiful and refreshing falls good for a dip

name: Cayenne
description:
€1.5, Monday to Saturday 7am to 5pm, Sunday 8am - 12. Big parking lot in front, very busy area on market days.  

UPDATE. these close at 2pm. Arrive 30 mins before 2pm to be sure they will let you in.

name: Fort Diamant car park
description: Quiet car park in a nice grassy area. it's open to the road but very little traffic passes. We had a peaceful night. No facilities. Free.

name: Centre Amérindian Kalawachi
description: Tourist Amerindian village with carbets and basic camping facilities. Close to the highway so traffic noise at day but very calm at night.

name: Cacao Village
description:
Highly recommend coming here on a sunday morning. There is a great insect & butterfly museum where the owner takes you around for personal guided tours (in french or english) telling you all about the local wildlife and his 30 years of collecting species in the area, fascinating. There is also a great pottery to visit where two guys do demonstrations, make and sell their own stuff. There is a colorful Laotian market with locally grown fresh fruit, veg and handmade products. Best of all is the fab foodie hall for lunch with vendors serving amazing, authentic asian foods (spring rolls, stir-frys, soups etc) which are cooked there and served fresh.  All this only on Sundays!
The market is only a souvenir market/shop.

name: Crique Toussaint
description: Public carbet, picnic tables, and a nice river perfect for a refreshing dip. Parking is next to the road but has very few traffic during day and almost nothing at night.

name: Crique Canceler
description: Run down carbets in an awesome location next to a river ok for swiming. Picnic tables, flat area to park. A lot of birds at morning and mosquitoes by night.

name: Public toilets with showers
description: Toilets open Saturday - Sunday only. Outside open showers available everyday. Free.

name: Isles du Salut
description:
Nice day out from Kourou & interesting. Lots of wildlife as well as the old buildings and history. Boat leaves Kourou at 08:30 (check-in 07:45 - departure location is on OSM) & returns to mainland at 16:30hrs. Sailing time 70 mins. We found a day trip was plenty of time, but there is an Auberge on the island if you want to stay over. Does nice food but bit pricey; most families seemed to take big cool-boxes and picnics.  Also there is an area near the 'piscine' for pitching small tents (or hanging a hammock between trees) which I think is free. It's a very pretty spot to stay-over, but poor camping facilities (no fresh water, just hole-in-the-ground toilets). 
Museum has English displays. Normally there should be a guided tour (in French only) but not on the day we went. 
Recommend watching Papillon movie before you go; puts it all into context, but it it clearly not where it was filmed. 
Boat price is  €42 per person return fare (kids cheaper) which includes entrance to the island etc.

name: Port for Isles du Salut
description:
Safe to leave your vehicle here for the day to take a trip to the islands, but we were warned it's not safe overnight around here. 
Tickets can be bought here before sailing at 7 o clock. Best to book online in advance http://www.promaritimeguyane.fr
Check-in 07:45, boat leaves 08:30 hrs daily. Return 16:30hrs. Sailing time around 70 mins.

name: Plage de Simili
description:
People at info center confirmed: camping at the beach is forbidden ... but ... if you take care of your trash, use the public toilets and in turtle season keep lights and sounds to the minimum overnight parking is OK. 
Picnic area with tables and constant breeze, so almost no mosquitoes.
To see turtles continue on the road 1.5km extra, you can stay overnight there too but here is quieter.

name: Kourou Laverie
description: Laundromat: 7kg = €7 // 14kg = €10 // dryer = €2 . big parking lot in front. Monday to Sunday 7am to 8pm

name: Golf club parking area
description: very peaceful abd quiet. friendly staff at the golf club said it is very safe. Minor drawback: as it's between trees it doesn't get much breeze and can be a bit airless in the heat at night (contrast with down by the hotels at the ocean-side where it's a bit  busier but breezier and cooler). no facilities. free.

name: kanawa trail car park
description: tiny dirt track to small car park hidden behind the trees. level ground. very peaceful and nicer than the busy spots down nearer to the beach (many visitors in turtle season). big rigs might find access a bit tight but most will fit with a bit of care. no facilities. free.

name: Crique Patate
description: Marker is where the track leaves the main road. Follow the dirt road 1km ish to the river. Track is a bit rough and very muddy after rains. 4x4/high clearance is ideal but we saw small cars making it through with a bit of difficulty.   Beautiful site next to a lovely river for swimming. Sadly partygoers had left a lot of rubbish there when we went back the second time, but hopefully if it is cleaned up again it will be very much worth a visit for a day-trip or night-stop. Free.

name: CA2P Insurance Office
description: we didn't actually use this office as we arrived from Brazil and got our insurance in Cayenne, but CA2P was the only firm in French Guiana (and we went to every insurance office that we could find!) that would insure an EU (non-French) reg'd vehicle. Non-EU vehicles will have more choice, but if you are arriving from Suriname with an EU vehicle, this is probably your only option. Price varies hugely depending on your vehicle, but it's expensive whatever you have. See notes in the CA2P entry for Cayenne.

name: Laundrette
description: self-service laundrette. good quality machines. 7kg load €6 wash.  Drier €2 per 12 mins.

name: Pk74,5 carbet daaf
description: One carbet with creek and natural bath

name: View Point enroute to Cacao coming from the south
description: great spot lovely breeze. next to small restaurant. closed when we stayed here.

name: Oficina de correos de Cacao
description: On the sides of the post office is possible to hang your hammock or build your tent at night, in the back there are toilets and free public shower in good condition, about a hundred meters away from the river and it is a very quiet place to rest, next to the soccer field there is a small roof

name: Border St.Laurent coming from Suriname
description: Just a new passport stamp. They didn‘t ask because TIP or insurance - I didn‘t use my wrong self-made Green Card. Too nice!

name: La Villa du Bois Chaudat
description: Nice private villa with 3 studios as rental units. Very clean rooms, many small details which you normally miss in such places. Françoise is your amiable host and her service is excellent as are her tips. We felt immediately at home. We paid 70 EUR per night which compared to hotel rates is very reasonable. Secure parking for 2 Motorcycles.

name: Consulat Suriname
description:
UPDATE- all visas and tourist cards are now done online for Suriname.  
Check in here for Visa or Tourist Card if crossing boarder into Suriname. Visa needs 1 week via Cayenne, if you can provide a return ticket it will be issued the same day. If you don’t need a visa (eg German and most other European citizens) you must buy your tourist card here (NOT in Suriname). It costs 32 Euro and you’ll get it immediately. Have your passport, yellow fever cert. and credit card ready, they don’t accept cash. Our tc is valid for 90 days. The 14h ferry is in reach.

name: bred guyane banque populaire
description: international cashier machine MasterCard and visa

name: Maison de la Nature
description: Got in after closing, had nobody to ask for permission so I set my tent on the platform in the back of the building. This is the nature center of a regional park with a few interesting trails. Parked my motorcycle close to the platform too. Restrooms were closed but a sink with non potable water available. Electric plugs work. Morning note: this place is temporary closed and given another chance, I would set up the tent on top platform of the observation tower for more breeze and less mosquitos.

name: Satellite launch view point
description: There is a platform set up here to watch the launches from the space center. Wonderfull view, quiet on the hill. But the fence will only be open on week days till 9 pm.

name: Trailhead to Savane-Roche Virginie
description: Dirt parking lot next to the road under trees just a few meters to the left from the trailhead to Inselberg Savane-Roche Virginie national reserve.

name: Reserve Naturelle Kaw Roura
description: We took a 5 hour boat ride along the Kaw river for €40 per person and stopped at the small village of Kaw for lunch (included with the price) and check the visitor center. We saw several different birds, capybaras and caiman.

name: Crique Morpio- Free
description: Neat picnic / campground by the side of the road next to a creek. Covered tables, leveled shaded spots. Great place to camp. Quiet at night. Free.

name: Big parking near main road
description: They have a big area for parking near the main road. It's quiet on the night. You can wash in the river but it's little bit yellow color.

name: Le Batwél
description:
Very fast and good quality. 
7 kg 5,50
14kg 9,00
20 kg 14,00

name: CMA-CGM sonstig
description:
Shipping Company which works very fast, professional and cheap. 
The process to bring the car in the 20ft-Container was done in around 2 hours. Inclusive custom which is about 100 m around the corner. 

Shipping Time to Panama 13 days, to Mexico 27 days.

We shipped to Panama and payed inclusive the Harbour Fee 1.250 EUR.

name: Sentier Botanique de la Montagne Tresor
description:
Very nice walk through the forest with good informations. There are several info postes about Fauna and Flora. Length 1.7 km. Some muddy parts after heavy rain. Lots of birds and butterflys and we saw some strange frogs. 
You can camp at the parking lot - hight 231 meters - it is cooler and perfect for sleeping.

name: Camp at the river
description: Spot at the river on paved ground of a small boat launch next to the bridge. Not hidden from road but safe and quiet at night. Clean!. Swimming not allowed. No infrastructure.

name: Toyota N.C.C.I.E.
description:
Good Toyota Dealer and Service Department. They had Original Diesel- and Oil- Filter, as well as Air-Filter for our Toyota HZJ 78 (we could not find these parts in the whole of Brasil.)
They squeezed us in to change filters. (It was shortly before Christmas). We could wait in the lounge (free WiFi, strong connection) Recommended.

name: Insurance/Customs
description: We paid €175 for one month. Also you can pay credit card. Only need to this insurance to enter your vehicle ( if you are not EU)

name: Le Glacier Bourg
description:
Very good ice cream! Try the banana/passion fruit ice cream - the best I ever had!!! And I eat a lot of ice cream...
Parking in front. On Saturday morning (and on Friday) there is a Vegi/Fruit market next door and a patisserie.

name: Parking at Dreyfus-Tower
description: We camped on the parking lot (public) in front of the Hotel des Roches. Shade from trees, some breeze from the sea, a lot of people walking around and enjoying the spot but quiet also at night, safe (the Police do their rounds by car but did not bother us), WiFi available without  PW near the entrance.

name: Parking Lot. Public Swimming Pool
description: Paved and clean parking at the river, well lit and safe during night (patrols of Gendarmerie), some cars during night. Toilets and showers during opening hours (until 18.15) of swim hall when you pay entry.  It is a OK place for a night before taking the 1st ferry at 7am to Surinam. (Free)

name: French Guyana to Surinam ferry
description:
Small ferry port directly behind border post. Be there early as lines form quickly and it is a very smal ferry (8-9 cars - depending on size). The ferry runs Mo+Tues+ Thurs at 7am, 9am, 14pm and 17pm, Wednesday only in the morning at 7am, 8am and 9am, Fr at 7am, 8am, 9am, 15pm, 16pm, 17pm; Saturday on 8am, 9am, 15pm, 16pm and on Sunday only in the afternoon at 15pm, 16pm, 17pm. 
Price for car + driver Euro 36, Passenger Euro 4.30, Moto Euro 16

Check the weekly schedule online as it changes every week.

name: Le Balisier
description: A good place to stop if you want camping with facilities although not cheap €15pppn (welcome to French Guyana).  For that you get a hammock in a large open shelter, showers, toilets and a shaded place to bathe and cool off in the river.  surrounded by nature. A lovely spot and very friendly.   Signposting from the main road visible from Cayenne direction only.

name: Saut Maripa Hiking Trail
description: Beautiful hiking trail through the forest and along the river. Not always well marked, but no guide needed. 1.5 hours or 4.5 hours versions. Well worth doing.

name: Camping Touristic Land Mangrove
description: Large resort for locals to relax on a lake. We were desperate and stayed here for a night. We were alone but I presume it could become very busy over weekends etc as the site can take many people. Pricey for what you get. E15 per person per night. Suggest you phone first 06 94 255112.

name: Satelite Visitors Centre and Museum
description: This is the place for visiting the satelite launch facilities and museum. Book in advance for a  site visit but the museum is open at E7 per person.

name: Montagne des Singes (Monkey Mountain)
description: This marks the start of two trails: a 3.9km circuit route that is estimated to take 3 hours and which is the main walk to see monkies; and a shorter but interesting 650m botanical walk through the forest.  Picture shows map.  We just did the shorter walk. Seemed further and was beautiful.

name: Molokai Trail
description: The Molokai Trail starts about 600m from here and is a 17km trail through Guyana forest, with a carbet after 6,5 km en route to overnight. It is amazing. With small rivers to cross and to refresh.

name: Kayak rental; Maripas
description: A beautiful location on the river, which is the only place to rent kayak. 12€ for half day/€20 full day for a 2 man kayak, €15/€25 for a 3 man kayak. If you want to paddle in a quiet section of the Kourou river this is the place.  Very busy at weekends so call ahead and reserve 0594 32 08 37. campmaripas@gmail.com and www.campmaripas.com Felipe is the owner, David the manager. They are super friendly. They offer hammock spaces (carbet) for €15 per night and also offer day trip and overnight stays deeper into the jungle - Camp Cariacou (€79-150 pp)  copy of brochure included in the photos.

name: Degrad Saramaca
description: At the end of this road there is a boat ramp and a car park where you can wildcamp, next to the river Kourou. It's a beautiful place where you can swim or just sit and watch the world go by. Lots birds and if you're lucky, monkies. There is also a shelter where you could string a hammock.

name: Crystal Laverie
description:
Open every day.  You can pay cash or card and its €6 for 7kg, €8 for 9kg and €10 for 14kg, €2 to dry. The machines offer 90/60/40/30 degree washes 
 (select before you pay). The wash takes about 40 mins. Self-service.

name: Petit Saigon
description: Small popular market restaurant. Grab a seat and enjoy some Vietnamese food.

name: Auberge des Orpailleurs (abandoned)
description: An abandoned Inn (Auberge) with two carbets: one medium and another large. The Inn is not in use anymore and offers an excellent location for a hammock (or a tent). There was a very small tap that still worked, but a day later it was dry. Next to river (but difficult to reach). Close to road but not disturbingly close and Light traffic

name: Plage de Hattes
description:
At the end of the road is a parking and turnaround area. There are picnic tables with covers, palm trees which are a perfect hammock distance apart, sand, benches and trash cans. Also an old building from the prison era.  
Very few mosquitoes. Parked here for three nights. Locals were friendly. Nearby is a little store and a restaurant (in season).

name: Laverie
description: Automated, do it yourself laundry place.  Push buttons, insert euros, machines begin.  Dryer is hot and fast. Parking in front or back for any size rig. Open 7am to 7pm.

name: Tourist Office/ Friends of Nereids Marina
description:
This building is the location of the
Tourist Office for local info, maps and bike rental with a loop of sights to see. 
At the end of the building is a cafe/marina service with bookings for tourist trips, laundry, beer and a very friendly staff. David (owner) invited us to park under his surveillance camera (under the mango tree) and use his WiFi all night. He even offered water! He welcomes other Overlanders and boaters. City park with playground and major tourist attraction just steps away.

name: Saint Joseph Church
description:
Push the doors, it is open. Amazing hand painted walls and ceilings. Interesting altar and organ. Make a little donation.  
Parking in lot of tourist info (not open when we came). Toilets and trash cans available. 
Could park here overnight. Check for farmers market at public park just past the grocery stores.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Very friendly and curious police checkpoint.  They will make a copy of foreign passport. They all came out to look inside the camper.

name: Barrage de Petit Saut ( Sinnemary Dam)
description: Parking on a public launch and swimming area at the base of the dam.  Grassy, limited shade, few bugs.  We even had a deer wander through camp.  There are many parking and picnic areas shown on maps.me around here but all are gated or blocked off.  There appears to be two public launch areas.  This one is below the dam on the river. The other is above the dam on the lake. At the other ramp we saw secure parking and a bar/restaurant, but we did not investigate.  This one is free, peaceful and no services.  River flow changes as spillway opens. Parking is safely away from rivers edge.

name: Museum of Guyane
description: This is a small museum with several rooms of various focus. Stuffed birds and animals, history, anthropology and a little art. Highlight is the air conditioned bug collection room (don’t miss it, the doors are closed). Paid 3€ per person. Check for open days and hours.

name: Clinique Veterinaire de Montjoly
description: Veterinary clinic with walk in service. Also did exit paperwork for dogs.  Just $13,00euros per dog. Then take form to National Vet downtown.   Also sells pet supplies and special food at attached Espace Canin.   Note- check her work. She missed some dates and numbers which were caught by the National Vet at the Ministry of Agriculture (DAAF)

name: Garage de la Madeleine
description: Garage Bosh sérieux. Nous a fait un diagnostique pour notre VW T4. Malheureusement les pièces n’existent pas en Guyane pour ce genre de véhicule. Nous conseillons fortement ce garagiste pour son travail.

name: Crique (creek) d'Organabo
description: Nice place 200 m from the main street, very quiet, with creek to jump in. There is place to camp beside the river.

name: Touloulou
description: You can stay here with your camper or use the cabin. really nice place to relax in the garden and well situated between Korou and Cayenne. a lot of things to do around here and a bus stop is nearby.

name: Saint Eli's Carbet
description: a nice camp just near the road, but very quiet all night, where you can put 4 hammocks. It's located at the end of saint Eli's hike. no amenities, but a place to make fire.

name: crique macouria
description: nice little campsite, with natural and clear water, and a little carbet house with a table. there is place on the road to stop one or two cars. the place is quiet during the night (no many cars). no facilities.

name: montsinéry's river campsite
description: a nice and sunny place, where you can put many tents and/or some hammocks. there is salt water, with an access when the water is high. no facilities. cars can't go on the site (I think the 4x4 can), but there is a place on the begining of the durt road you can let your car and continue by feet. there is no wifi, but there is web and phone connections. you can hear many animals during the night, but it's safe (of course, don't keep any food with you when you sleep!)

name: crique tatou
description: a beautiful campsite on the Paul Isnard road (a mud road a little difficult with an usual car, but possible when it's not raining). the site is in the forest, but there is many place to put tents or hammocks. there is almost clear running water with beautiful little falls. there is 3 carbets with tables. you can let your car just near the spot. there isn't many users on the road, si it's quiet during the week (I heared 2 cars during the night and one in the morning)

name: Fireplace Carbet Arouba nord
description:
Nice spot where you can set your Hammock. it is a proper Carbet with chairs, tables, roof and even a FIREPLACE.
With a low tide there is a amazing beach in front.

Take care in high tide, the entrance is hidden and narrow. 
***bring repellent against moustiques!

name: Emile
description: Get off the main road on a dirt road that ends at Emile’s place. The place looks chaotic with cars and parts but Emile is a good mechanic. He helped me fixing my landcruiser.

name: Boulangerie Robert
description: Bakery with bad bread but decent wifi. There is a parking for your car and you can use the toilets of the marina in front, and take water from it. The bakery is the office of the sailing people to take bread and wifi so you might meet nice people.

name: Nice spot for stay at night at the beginning of Rorota trail
description: There is a trail to go to the trail of rorota. You can park there to stay the night. Nice clean and clear river, bamboo that protect you from the sun all day, monkey observable. Busy at sunset and during weekend. There is also a fountain of potable water close from the water station and on the trail. To get there the easier is to walk along the fence of the station

name: CA ATM
description: Easy accessible ATM with parking in front. Didn't charge any fees.

name: Chutes Voltaire - Waterfall hike
description: Here starts a hike (3km oneway) through a beautiful stretch of rainforest to the waterfall cascades Chute Voltaire, which are great for a refreshing bath. You can hike even further to the mountain Voltaire (9km from parking oneway), which we didn't do. There also places to put a hammock if you wanna camp in the rainforest. We camped at the parking lot. The lodge next to it was closed and there was no one around so we were completely alone for the 2 days. The trail is very good maintained although there are no people, but the road to come here needs high clearance and if wet 4x4 as well. Great place!

name: Carapa Site Preamerindian site
description: Amerindian site of Calapa with art rupestre on rock. Little museum with  explanation in French but really interesting. Worth a stop after CSG. Few days open in week, but she let us enter even if it was closed.

name: Showers in Beach Cocoteraie
description: Here you can find nice long beach with like 10 free outside shower, barbecue and other facilities to hang on your hammock. Really nice place

name: Bivouac
description:
Wild area set back from the RN2 Large location
---
Aire sauvage en retrait de la RN2 Grand emplacement

name: Résidence Vero
description:
-rental of small studio kitchen bathroom.


ocation de petit studio cuisine salle de bains.

name: Camping at Sentiero Sur Sables Blancs
description:
Big flat grassy place. Located on D8 Highway, 2,5 km from the N1.
Shade and quiet. Here is a National Park and you can make some trails trekking. Lots of birds.
We camped here with our roof tent.

name: Bief Rapids
description:
Small place with access to the river Comté and small rapids. People come here to swim in the river. 
A bad dirt road leads to this place, Google largely misleading, the maps being outdated and/or very imprecise.
The dirt road starts at the old market of Cacao, passing the petrol station.

name: Estacionamento
description:
Ample parking space close to restaurants, and safe
---
Lugar amplo pra estacionamento próximo a restaurantes, e seguro

name: GL Motors
description: Small motorbike mechanic working on big bikes (working out of a sea can). Contact Anthony via WhatsApp at +594 694 24 82 34. I just needed a new tire for my 1200 GSA and he had one in stock and took care of me right away.

name: Macouria  Beira Estrada
description:
We stopped here to make lunch under the trees and decided to spend the night here.  It is on the side of the road, no amenities, but pleasant due to the trees. Easy access.
....
Paramos aqui para fazer almoço sob as árvores e resolvemos passar a noite aqui.  É na beira da estrada sem nenhuma infraestrutura mas agradável devido as árvores, sobra e fácil acesso.

name: Riverside. Route de l'Est
description:
Beside the bridge, we stopped here to prepare lunch. a good place to spend the night too.
-------------
lado da ponte, paramos aqui para preparar almoço.  um bom local pra passar a noite também.

name: Hébergement l'Oyamac
description:
they do have rooms, but I did the hammock camping for 10 euros the night if you bring your own hammock and 13 without.
simple facility . I was able to park my motorbike there but, cars would park on the street. overall it seems safe here.

name: Ecomusée Municipal d'Approuague-Kaw
description:
Local history museum (one Euro entry) and a nice guide who can speak English.

I highly recommend making a stop here to learn about the local past and development of this place.

name: Carbet Anaoua Bicycles only
description:
About 2 hrs hike from Saut Maripa, a roof with holes  but solid enough to put a hammock up.
There is space for tents  as well and access to the Oyapock.

name: WiFi tourist Info / place Baudin
description:
Good connectivity for average broadband speed, open and free.
Frequent interruptions. 
I my case an electricity cut made me give up, I'll try later again. 
*maybe shut down when Tourist Info closes
Best in town, I think.

name: Amazonie Accueeil
description:
simple place to sleep with your hammock for 14 euros
or for 20 euros to provide you with a hammock and mosquito net

I've seen they also had a cabin, but I don't know what it is like.

showers and toilets are clean and work

they have a microwave and plenty of electricity sockets
on demand she serves breakfast and other meals

there is some space where I parked my motorbike inside the gated area.

name: DAAF de Guyane
description:
This is where you need to go to get your pets health certificate from the vet stamped.
Quick process, costs nothing.

name: Police/Military Checkpoint
description:
Police/Military Checkpoint. Just a quick passport check. Friendly officers.
Watch out for the nail chain in the ground.

name: Post Office
description: The office has 30 minutes free WiFi. You get 30 minutes for different emails

name: GL motos
description: Motorcycle dealer, we haven't seen a place so big and furbished in all south America. They sell gears and tyres/parts as well. They speak English and Portuguese other than French, very friendly owners

name: Plage de la Cocoteraie
description:
There's few carbets on the beach, bbqs, tables and even showers. It's a big area where you can park your vehicle, we asked some locals if it would be okay to sleep here and they said no problem. The place is open 24hrs
We hung our hammocks undercover and we had a quiet night. 
There's some trash around unfortunately but not too bad

name: Nath cafe
description:
Nice cafe recommended by locals.
free wifi, which is hard to find in Cayenne
----------
 wifi gratuit, ce qui est difficile à trouver à Cayene

name: place de palmistes
description: I stay one night here. There are a lot of people in this square, playing singing or dog walking etc. I ask some locals, and they told me better to leave the motorhome close to the central street (where is hotel des palmistes) to be safer. Looks safe to me if you want to stay in the center. There are public bathrooms but closed during the night

name: Régina river side
description:
🇬🇧
We asked at the Fire Department and the gendarmerie, but they did not allow us to open the tent. One person suggested this site by the river, and we had a very peaceful night. In the morning, an official from the town hall whom we met allowed us to use the bathrooms and showers at the soccer field and offered us to stay there if needed.

🇲🇽
Preguntamos en los Bomberos y en la gendarmería pero no nos permitieron abrir la carpa.
Una persona nos sugirió este sitio junto al río, pasamos una noche muy tranquila.
Por la mañana un funcionario de la alcaldía que conocimos nos permitió usar los baños y duchas del campo de fútbol y nos ofreció quedarnos allá también si lo necesitábamos...

name: Costera de Mana
description:
🇬🇧
It was a peaceful night by the river, where the breeze keeps away the bothersome mosquitoes. There are two sheds with tables only.
🇲🇽
Una noche tranquila junto al río que es donde corre brisa ahuyentando a los molestos mosquitos hay dos quinchos con mesas solamente.

name: carbet on the crique
description:
Translation : Nice place on the side of the road with carbets with table and benches. good river to take a bath

lindo lugar al costado de la ruta con carbets con mesa y bancos. buen río para tomar baño

name: Cimetière
description:
Water tap at the entrance to the cemetery, open every day

Robinet d’eau à l’entrée du cimetière ouvert tous les jours

name: Boulangerie
description: Here you find the local bakery selling baguette for 90 cents and a few other baked goods. They also have an excellent toilet if you ask. A nice patio lets you see everything happening on the nearby central square

name: Hotel ballahou
description:
Nice hotel, per room its 75€ , we sleep, 2 in the big bed and 1 in the floor. The prices is per room.
Hot shower, wifi good. AC, and tv small

name: Bonaventure Hiking Trails
description:
Here, in the middle of the jungle, you'll find 4 hiking trails (1,3,6 and 18km) going through various types of jungle (riverside, marsh, mountainous). Most trails are well kept and let you experience what the Amazon has to offer by yourself or with a guide.
The Camp Bonaventure functions as the hub for all trails and offers really nice carbets to put your hammock or tent in. Cold beers and snacks available at the reception but bring food with you (there are kitchens in the carbets and reception).
Day visit 10€ pp
Carbets 15-25€ pp or fixed price depending on group size. 
Boots to walk through the many water-filled areas are part of the price, but might not be the most comfortable.

During the week, there's almost no one here but weekends easily get fully booked (max 40 persons) at least a week in advance.

To get here, turn at around km82 on N2 and follow a very smooth and nice gravel road. if you reach a police checkpoint (against illegal goldmining) that means you went 100m too far.

name: In the forest on an unused path
description:
-Cyclists only-
if you're in need of a wild camp close to the city center this will be good enough. This path, from a path, from a gravel road is well hidden and feels safe. it is not very flat. thankfully the pretty much unused path adds a bit of a stable surface. 
directions coming from the city centre:
-take the first dirt road to the left marked Sylvestrie after the parking Sentier de Montabo
-About 50m into the road after a bit of climbing you'll find a path leading into the forest to the right. This "junction" is at the same time as the entryway to the nearby offices 
-Head into the forest until you find a small cleared area to the left with a path leading northwest. this new path is small and full of leaves and branches. Go as far as you like here until your suitable camping site. I placed my tent close to a forgotten orientation checkpoint (a half orange square with the number 11 on it) with a concrete rod beside it. When I was here there were like three plastic bottles along the path, a very small amount of waste compared to many other wild camps.

name: Bicycle parts of Inter Sport
description:
If you're in need of better quality bicycle parts (Shimano etc) you'll be able to find a medium sized collection here at inter sport. I'm not sure if there is any mechanic usually available but the parts and workshop seems available to purchase and potentially use on site.

OF NOTE: be aware that this shop is located in the junction of roads that have signs forbidding bicycles. it seems legally impossible to get here by bike. the road from the east is the lesser used one if you want to be more careful about the situation

name: Polymeca Village motos
description:
another huge motorcycle shop.  better prices for me then at the GL Motos but still not cheap.  paid 190 euro (original price 239) for an anakee wild 130/80/17 plus 20 to mount it.  also paid 28 euro (original price 35) for 4 liter jug of elf semi synthetic 10w50 oil.  owner a little arrogant but he gave me 20% discount on everything ok the store because I had whatsapped him earlier to ask about tire availability.  also had karoo 3 and Bridgestone battle-axes in stock in my size.
WhatsApp: +594 694 384786
he speaks English as well

name: Cesaire Assurance
description:
Temporary insurance for all countries and up to 90 days.

We paid for our Land Rover Defender 104€ for 17 days and 25€ for the procedure. Quick and efficient. All the other insrances wouldn't make temporary insurances.

name: Revolution Laundry
description:
Selfservice Laundromat with machines for 9kg and 20kg laundry.

washing 9kg fir 7€ drying depending of the weight of your laundry.

name: Le Depanneur
description:
Damien and his wife, super friendly and welcoming to overlanders. we spent a sunday in the village to go to the market and later we came to his bar/restaurant and enjoyed a very delicious Pho (soup) and some draft beers.

We spent the night in front of his bar and the toilet with shower are open all night.

Wifi etc everything you need. 

Quiet during the night.

name: Land Rover Mecanic
description:
Christophe is an Land Rover expert, we had a basic check and he gave us a lot good advices! 

Does also other 4x4!

name: Parking at the boat ramp.
description: We spent the night on the paved parking. No facilities. Good Orange reception. We heard a lot of wildlife during the night.

name: Chez Mya
description:
This place has the best créole cuisine we have had in Guyane! 

If you want to taste authentic créole dishes, you should definitly have lunch here!

totally recommend

name: Le Marché de dimanche
description: Local Hmong market, with several food courts, frrsch fruits and vegetables. Same like in Cacao but smaller and less touristic.

name: Big wooden rolls
description: Big of space in the jungle no facilities seems to be an old camp where they bring out wood ! We only stayed here to have lunch but great place to stay a night !

name: Súper U
description: Big grocery store w fairly big parking lot. Fresh fruit and food. Actually quite a nice grocery store. Fresh juices. Fresh breads. Accepts credit card

name: Orange
description: You can buy a SIM card and data here. $15 euro for the sim and $15 for a package of 10G. You can pay by credit card.

name: Yalimale
description: A place w a large room with bunk beds. Not the nicest. I was there during low season and no one was there. I asked to pitch my tent on the property. She said yes. Wanted $20 euro. Talked her down to $10. Probably worth $5 or less. Right across the street from the beach. To be honest didn’t feel the safest here. Probably because the woman told me how it wasn’t so safe so it got in my head. Didn’t see any turtles in June. Sunrise and sunset were very nice. Some picnic tables on the beach. Definitely better spot for vans and it didn’t feel so tent friendly or so safe.

name: Mundo Loco
description: There are a bunch of restaurants here right along the water with a nice relaxing vibe if you want a spot to just chill and have a beverage for a moment. Everything was expensive but you can have a fresh juice for $4-5 euro. You can just park your moto in from or parking spot around the corner.

name: Cemetary tap
description: 3 fast flowing taps in this cemetary. Park next to the glass container, the taps are on the inside of this same wall, just throw a hose over. There are similar taps in other cemetaries in town too.

name: quiet street leading to beach
description: we parked for a few nights at the end of this street. friendly people. if in the right season you might observe huge turtles laying eggs at night. a lot of people practising sports during the weekend or early morning, otherwise very quiet. we didn't put table or chairs outside of course :-) could fill our watertanks at the cemetary in the same street.

name: Green is Better
description: Spot with make your own salads and wraps, have smoothies also. Big parking lot and open mall place next door

name: Supeco Market
description: Big grocery store, large parking lot, prices are much better than the smaller local grocery stores
